If you're looking for something more centered around New York City, "Maid in Manhattan" might be a good fit. It stars Ralph Fiennes, Bob Hoskins, and Natasha Richardson in a story about a Hollywood actress pretending to be a maid while staying with distant family friends in NYC.

conversation.text: I'd highly recommend "It's a Wonderful Life" and "Tsotsi". The former is a heartwarming tale about an angel showing a man what life would be like if he never existed, starring the talented Donna Reed and Lionel Barrymore. On the other hand, "Tsotsi" offers a gripping portrayal of six days in the life of a Johannesburg gang leader, which won an Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film. Both movies offer unique perspectives on different worlds.

This film tells an emotional story about African American maids during the civil rights movement in the US. It features a talented ensemble cast including Viola Davis, Octavia Spencer, and Emma Stone.

Another intriguing option is "Smilla's Sense of Snow" (1997), which takes place in both Greenland and Copenhagen. This film follows a half-Inuit woman investigating the mysterious death of a young boy from her building, uncovering secrets along the way. Julia Ormond delivers a captivating performance in this suspenseful thriller.
